answers.answer: HI!Your success with IVF (or anything else for that matter ) will be improved by weight loss. At many IVF clinics, they will give you a better deal (financially speaking) if you are a good candidate for success--meaning if you are young, healthy, and thin.  It may very well be that the hormones are keeping you from losing any more weight.EVERYTHING about your health AND your baby's health will be improved if you can get down to that BMI of 39 that you are hoping for!Obese patients have a higher risk of stillbirth, miscarriage, gestational diabetes, pre-eclampsia, c-section. . .you get my point!Can they tighten the band?Good luck!Dr B

question: Should I just start  IVF? We were referred to a fertility clinic about 9 months ago and I take follicle stimulating drugs and then a trigger to assist ovulation.I've been given some conflicting medical advice re weight loss (ie. yes you should or IVF is a waste of money, and no, you should start IVF now)I had a lap band about 2 years ago and lost 35 kilograms. Since we started seeing the baby-making guru I haven't lost any weight. Not sure why, probably the stress of it all! I do feel if I gave myself 6 to 12 months I could love another 35 kilograms which wold put me in a healthier BMI range. But my then I would be approaching 39.Thanks in advance, I'm feeling a little alone and lonely.PS We don't have any children (yet :-) )
